entry.title: Entry #173 in IN RE TESLA ADVANCED DRIVER ASSISTANCE SYSTEMS LITIGATION, 3:22-cv-05240
entry.summary: ORDER: The parties' 172 joint discovery letter is denied without prejudice. It is clear from the face of the letter that the parties have not adequately met and conferred regarding the issues therein. In addition, the parties are advised that the judiciary ran out of funding on October 20, 2025. As a consequence, court staff are not being paid despite the requirement to work on essential matters. Accordingly, until the judiciary is funded, before filing a joint discovery letter, the parties must meet and confer to determine whether the litigation can proceed without a determination of the discovery dispute, or whether the dispute must be urgently resolved. If the latter, lead counsel shall file a certification attesting to the same. Signed by Chief Magistrate Judge Donna M. Ryu on 10/23/2025. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (dmrlc1, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 10/23/2025) (Entered: 10/23/2025)

entry.title: Entry #168 in IN RE TESLA ADVANCED DRIVER ASSISTANCE SYSTEMS LITIGATION, 3:22-cv-05240
entry.summary: Minute Entry for proceedings held by zoom webinar before Judge Rita F. Lin: Initial Case Management Conference held on 9/24/2025. Court set the following deadlines:Notice of Depositions due 3/6/2026Close of Fact Discovery due by 4/3/2026. Private mediation deadline: 4/17/2026; Joint letter naming mediator and date of mediation due 2/6/2026.Initial Expert Reports due by 5/1/2026. Rebuttal Reports due by 5/29/2026. Close of Expert Discovery due by 6/19/2026. Dispositive Motion due by 7/10/2026. Responses due by 8/7/2026. Replies due by 8/28/2026. Motion Hearing set for 9/22/2026 10:00 AM in San Francisco, Courtroom 15, 18th Floor before Judge Rita F. Lin. Final Pretrial Conference set for 12/15/2026 02:30 PM in San Francisco, Courtroom 15, 18th Floor.Jury Selection/Jury Trial set for 1/11/2027 09:00 AM in San Francisco, Courtroom 15, 18th Floor before Judge Rita F. Lin. Digital Recording Time: 10:03 - 10:08 = 5 Minutes. Plaintiff Attorneys: Julie Fieber, Gayle Blatt, Makena-Kala Kershaw. Defendant Attorneys: Chris Casamassima, Josh Vittor. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (afm, COURT STAFF) (Date Filed: 9/24/2025) (Entered: 09/24/2025)

entry.title: Entry #160 in IN RE TESLA ADVANCED DRIVER ASSISTANCE SYSTEMS LITIGATION, 3:22-cv-05240
entry.summary: Order by Judge Rita F. Lin granting in part and denying in part 137 Administrative Motion to File Under Seal. The motion to seal is GRANTED as to all of the specified portions of the documents described in the 139 declaration, except for all specified paragraphs of Exhibit 2, paragraphs 29 and 34 of Exhibit 3, and paragraph 26 of Exhibit 4, for which sealing is DENIED. Those portions contain information that was already disclosed in the briefing or information that does not appear to confidential. The parties are further ORDERED to file redacted versions of the documents for partial sealing requests that were granted to the extent those have not already been filed, and unsealed versions of the requests that were denied by 9/2/25. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (rfllc2, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 8/19/2025) (Entered: 08/19/2025)
